title: IGP: Police will keep tabs on serial rapist when he returns
text:
KUALA LUMPUR: Notorious serial rapist Selva Kumar Subbiah, convicted of sexually assaulting dozens of women in Toronto, Canada, will be closely monitored by police once he steps foot on Malaysian soil, said Tan Sri Khalid Abu Bakar.
Confirming that his Canadian counterpart has informed him that Selva Kumar will be deported on Sunday, the Inspector-General of Police said police would be awaiting him upon arrival.
“We will monitor him based on his criminal records and through the existing jurisdiction and authority we have,” he said on Wednesday.
Police will also record a statement from Selva Kumar, Khalid added.
“We will be there to record his statement but he is a free man.
“We will also request for all of Selva Kumar’s criminal records from the Canadian authorities,” he said.
The IGP was responding to a report by the Toronto Star that Selva Kumar will be deported to Malaysia on Feb 5.
Selva Kumar will remain in custody in Canada until he is deported, even though he has served his entire 24-year prison sentence. Canadian Immigration officers will escort him when he is deported.
A Canadian immigration board decided Monday to extend Selva Kumar’s detention until he’s booted out of Canada.
Canada Border Services Agency had earlier confirmed Selva Kumar was “under an enforceable deportation order,” but was not prepared to reveal his whereabouts.
He was convicted of drugging and sexually assaulting dozens of women in the late 1980s and early 1990s while posing as a modelling agent, movie producer and professional dancer.
He was convicted at two separate trials more than two decades ago of drugging and sexually assaulting 30 women.
Parole authorities refused to let him out early, as they feared the threat of him committing new offences was high.
